intro: Parosela longeracemosa, commonly known as the long-branch parosela, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, drooping inflorescences that bear small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth surface and a slightly pubescent underside. Parosela longeracemosa is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
